metadata.title: CVE-2017-9998 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
The _dwarf_decode_s_leb128_chk function in dwarf_leb.c in libdwarf through2017-06-28 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(Segmentation fault) via a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9998` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dwarfdump - 20180129-1
libdwarf1 - 20180129-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dwarfutils package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '20180129-1').
